projects: [{"title":"Performance Analysis of LTE Scheduling Algorithms.","start_date":"Apr 2023","end_date":"May 2023","description":"Analysed different scheduling algorithms in LTE such as Round Robin, Proportional Fair, Priority Set Scheduler and Blind Equal Throughput using the metrics of average throughput and fairness. The entire simulation was performed using ns-3 considering near cell, far cell, stationary UEs, mobile UEs and heavy load scenarios."},{},{"title":"Multi-Radar Fall Detection in NLOS Conditions.","start_date":"Feb 2023","end_date":"Apr 2023","description":"Proposed a novel fall detection method that uses two mmWave radars in nonline-of-sight (NLoS) conditions, where one of the two radars is blocked by an object in the environment. The method employed a combination of point coordinate and doppler values obtained from the point cloud data of the radars. Target identification is done using DBSCAN, the largest cluster in a frame being identified as the subject. A novel heuristic-based algorithm was proposed to detect fall events, where a fall event is classified as the subject falling down on the ground and remaining there for a certain amount of time. We conducted experiments in various fall and non-fall scenarios with different subjects and the results provided fall detection rate of 80% for LoS cases and 88% for NLoS cases when two radars are used, while maintaining a false alarm rate of just 23% for non-falls."},{},{},{},{"title":"Personalized Hotel Recommender using Sentiment Analysis","start_date":"Sep 2022","end_date":"Dec 2022","description":"Used both supervised (Multi-class Logistic Regression, Multinomial Naive Bayes, and Support Vector Machine) and Unsupervised (KMeans, Gaussian Mixture Models(GMM), and Hierarchical Clustering) learning algorithms to recommend hotels based on user aspect and past reviews. Employed supervised learning for sentiment analysis and unsupervised for clustering of aspects in reviews. Achieved an accuracy of about 75% for former and Davies-Bouldin index of 0.43 for latter."},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Precoding Technique Analysis for Massive MIMO Systems","start_date":"Sep 2022","end_date":"Dec 2022","description":"Analyzed different precoding algorithms in Massive MIMO to reduce system complexity. Considered multicell Minimum Mean Squared Error (M-MMSE), Single-cell Minimum Mean Squared Error (S-MMSE), Regularized Zero-Forcing (R-ZF), Zero Forcing (ZF) and Maximal Ratio transmission (MR) precoding schemes. Also, explored uplink-downlink duality theory to choose the precoding vectors in downlink channel."},{}]
